definition: (idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: They all pitched in and soon finished the job.
sentences.chinese: 大家七手八脚，工作很快就完成了。

sentences.english: With everybody lending a hand, the courtyard was soon swept clean.
sentences.chinese: 大家七手八脚一会儿就把院子打扫干净了。

sentences.english: Somehow I managed to lug the wet clothes to the laundromat.
sentences.chinese: 最后我七手八脚的把湿衣服拖到了自助洗衣店里。

sentences.english: The police bundled him into a car.
sentences.chinese: 警察七手八脚把他推上了汽车。

sentences.english: So it was facing this strain of grass, busy divvying put up a video camera.
sentences.chinese: 于是大家对着这株草，七手八脚地架起了摄像机。

definition: three, set five remove two (abacus rule)/efficiently/quickly and easily
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
in a great rush/in a flurry
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
